metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32359 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: This issue was addressed with improved redaction of sensitive information. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.7.2 and iPadOS 16.7.2. A user's password may be read aloud by VoiceOver.

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8 mdeslaur> It is no longer possible to build new webkit2gtk versions on focal and earlier. Marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
